member.name: M:ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.ChartJsInterop.StripNulls(ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.Common.ConfigBase)
member.summary:
Returns an object that is equivalent to the given parameter but without any null member AND it preserves DotNetInstanceClickHandler/DotNetInstanceHoverHandler members intact
Preserving DotNetInstanceClick/HoverHandler members is important because they contain DotNetObjectRefs to the instance whose method should be invoked on click/hover
This whole method is hacky af but necessary. Stripping null members is only needed because the default config for the Line charts on the Blazor side is somehow messed up. If this were not the case no null member stripping were necessary and hence, the recovery of the DotNetObjectRef members would also not be needed. Nevertheless, The Show must go on!

member.name: T:ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.Common.Enums.AxisType
member.summary: As per documentation here https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/axes/cartesian/

member.name: P:ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.Common.Enums.AxisType.Linear
member.summary:
The linear scale is use to chart numerical data. As the name suggests, linear interpolation is used to determine where a value lies on the axis.
Can be used both for Radial and for Cartesian Axes
For cartesian: It can be placed on either the x or y axis. The scatter chart type automatically configures a line chart to use one of these scales for the x axis.

member.name: P:ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.Common.Enums.AxisType.Logarithmic
member.summary: The logarithmic scale is use to chart numerical data. It can be placed on either the x or y axis. As the name suggests, logarithmic interpolation is used to determine where a value lies on the axis.

member.name: P:ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.Common.Enums.AxisType.Category
member.summary:
If global configuration is used, labels are drawn from one of the label arrays included in the chart data. If only data.labels is defined, this will be used. If data.xLabels is defined and the axis is horizontal, this will be used. Similarly, if data.yLabels is defined and the axis is vertical, this property will be used. Using both xLabels and yLabels together can create a chart that uses strings for both the X and Y axes. Specifying any of the settings above defines the x axis as type: 'category' if not defined otherwise. For more fine-grained control of category labels it is also possible to add labels as part of the category axis definition. Doing so does not apply the global defaults.
See https://www.chartjs.org/docs/latest/axes/cartesian/category.html

member.name: P:ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.Common.Enums.AxisType.Time
member.summary: The time scale is used to display times and dates. When building its ticks, it will automatically calculate the most comfortable unit base on the size of the scale.

Note that this only applies to cartesian charts.

member.name: P:ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.LineChart.Axes.Ticks.CartesianTicks.LabelOffset
member.summary:
Distance in pixels to offset the label from the centre point of the tick (in the x direction for the x axis, and the y direction for the y axis).
Note: this can cause labels at the edges to be cropped by the edge of the canvas.

member.name: P:ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.LineChart.Axes.Ticks.CartesianTicks.MaxRotation
member.summary:
Maximum rotation for tick labels when rotating to condense labels.
Note: Rotation doesn't occur until necessary.
Note: Only applicable to horizontal scales.

member.name: P:ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.LineChart.Axes.Ticks.CartesianTicks.MinRotation
member.summary:
Minimum rotation for tick labels.

member.name: P:ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.LineChart.Axes.Ticks.CartesianTicks.Mirror
member.summary:
Flips tick labels around axis, displaying the labels inside the chart instead of outside.
Note: Only applicable to vertical scales.

member.summary: If false, the line is not drawn for this dataset. Default is true. If you are filling and dont want to show the line, then change to false.

member.name: P:ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.ScatterChart.ScatterDataset.SpanGaps
member.summary: If true, lines will be drawn between points with no or null data. If false, points with NaN data will create a break in the line

member.name: P:ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.ScatterChart.ScatterDataset.SteppedLine

If the line is shown as a stepped line. Use for available options.
If the steppedLine value is set to anything other than , will be ignored.

member.name: P:ChartJs.Blazor.ChartJS.ScatterChart.ScatterDataset.BorderColor

member.name: T:ChartJs.Blazor.Util.Color.ColorUtil
member.summary: Provides useful methods for working with colors. Particularly the conversion from different kinds of C#-colors to string colors which are understood by javascript/css.

member.name: M:ChartJs.Blazor.Util.Color.ColorUtil.ColorHexString(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
